Description.Name: REPEAT OFFENSE, RE:Article 6, Paragraph 3, Subsection C
Description.Details: Darius knocks on the open doorway to you office before entering, carrying a datapad, “Commander, we’ve received another communique from the Commercial Jumpship Travel Authority.” You take the datapad and read the message on the screen: COMMERICAL JUMPSHIP TRAVEL AUTHORITY, Compliance Divison Attention Commander {COMMANDER.FirstName} {COMMANDER.LastName}, of the mercenary company {COMPANY.CompanyName}: We have now received over a dozen complaints regarding and/or relating to the substitution of data stored onboard the NavComs of various jumpships tasked with transporting {COMPANY.CompanyName} and it’s dropship, the ARGO. Specifically, empirical proof has been provided to the CJSTA that one or more members of {COMPANY.CompanyName} and/or computers onboard the ARGO have maliciously and intentionally accessed NavCom systems onboard a Jumpship hired to transport the ARGO and its crew. As you were previously informed, and assessed penalties on this same matter, we need to remind you that accessing a Jumpship’s internal computer systems without authorisation is deemed a Class E Felony which provides the CJSTA the authority to impose sanctions, fines and ultimately blacklisting of those guilty from using the CJSTA network. The Association has investigated the data presented and rules in favour of the Jumpship Captains. As such, {COMPANY.CompanyName} is being re-issued a Non-Compliance of By-Laws ruling and… You stop reading there, recalling the last time this came up, and toss the datapad on the desk, “How bad is it this time, Darius?” Darius picks up the pad, “Well, basically we now have another mark against us for using the Console to trick those jumpships into arriving at Pirate Points. The CJSTA wants compensation again, this time with much higher penalties. As before, they have offered two options to pay this debt: pay the fine as a lump sum now or agree to a slight increase to our jumpship costs.” Darius looks up from the datapad and awaits your decision.

Description.Name: up to ¢4,000,000 Cash
Description.Details: pay the damn fine

Description.Name: Pay ¢2,658,165 fine
Description.Details:
You look at Darius, "So how bad are the penalties this time?"

Darius consults the datapad, "We are ordered to pay a lump sum fine of  ¢2,658,165 as restitution."

"Damnit," you say as you sit back and in your chair, “Darius, accept their terms and pay the damn fine.”

Description.Name: Pay ¢2,900,154 fine
Description.Details:
You look at Darius, "So how bad are the penalties this time?"

Darius consults the datapad, "Well, according to them, we have been cited for..."

You interupt, "Just the short version."

Darius nods, "We are ordered to pay a lump sum fine of  ¢2,900,154 as restitution."

"Damnit," you say as you sit back and in your chair, “Darius, accept their terms and pay the damn fine.”

Description.Name: Increased Jump Costs
Description.Details: pay the damn fine

Description.Name: Jump Cost ¢1,500
Description.Details:
You look at Darius, "How bad are the jump costs now?"

Darius consults the datapad, "Our the jump costs have increased by an extra ¢1,500 per jump."

"For Fu....," you mumble as you sit back and in your chair, “Darius, draw up a letter of acceptance and agree to the increase.”
